page.title: 01BRYNNAU-GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Brynna is situated within the Taff Ely District.A small rural village approx {6\}miles West of Bridgend.Brynna is a small settlement with the public house ,the church and some shops serving the needs of the farming community.It is bordered by the rivers Ciwi and Ewenny.With the discovery of coal in the village many emnigrants ,seeking work came from different areas e.g.Forest Of Dean with the result that the welsh language has never been nurtured or encouraged until this century.The village began to develop eventually linking with the next village of Llanharan.New council housing was built after the{2nd World {War.}Due to it's attractive situation private housing soon came into existence.The village today is more of a satellite to the towns either side, Llanharan and Pencoed.Cont.Pg.19
